pageContext.claim: “The Times should never have done that, because really what they've done is, virtually, you know it's treason.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump suggests the New York Times but he's wrong. Treason against the United States is limited under Article III of the Constitution to "levying war against the United States, or adhering to their enemies, giving them aid and comfort." Writing an unflattering editorial about the President is pretty remote from either of those categories. “There is a very big difference between disloyalty to a President and disloyalty to the United States,” said Carlton F.W. Larson is a professor of law at the University of California at Davis and author of the forthcoming book in treason. “And it was precisely to prevent any such confusion that the framers drafted Article III as carefully as they did.”
